oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NEAR-SHORE CURRENTS IN FRINGING REEF ENVIRONMENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Heitmann, Troy
Roeber, Volker
Cheung, Kwok Fai
Smith, David
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Coral reefs protect the coast from erosion and flood hazards through breaking of energetic waves offshore. The enhanced circulation, generated through wave breaking and setup, sustains a diversity of marine life in the sheltered near-shore environment. We present a combined field and numerical study to investigate the complex physical processes over fringing reefs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; posters.27
